topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5386a26d63687219666a0000#post_5386a26d63687219666a0000
Just be sure you have hearing protection and a _VERY FIRM_ grip on the gun when you fire it. 45's can have quite a kick to them. I would recommend starting with a .22 pistol, they are very easy to fire and won't intimidate you. After that, work your way up to a 9mm then to a .357. After that you will be well versed enough for a .45. If you really feel bold try a 500 S&W, but I warn you that you could hurt or even break your wrist if you are not careful.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e
